content.description: This boulder is lodged at the base of the cliff next to "Simba". It has a verity of Veasy to V1 climbs on it. The rock quality is not great, as it has been known to crumble and flake. Regardless, this boulder has some nice features, and makes for a pleasent warmup spot if you're feeling it.
content.location: Walk from the road into the woods, on the same side of the road as the house. The cliff face should be visible if you walk into the woods a few yards. Go to the largest cliff face and under it you will see this boulder, as well as "Simba".

content.description: One of the most easily identifiable problems within the crumble crag sub area and a really short problem at that. Sit start with your right hand wrapped around the far side and your left wrapped around the right, following the line over a few moves to the end where you flip over and top out. Kind of a sketchy landing all covered in rock, not really worth doing unless you have 4+ crash pads to break a fall and have already climbed everything else.
content.location: Located at the base of the cliff a short walk from the road. An easy way to know you are in the right spot. On the right side of the warm up boulder.

content.description: Just about as mossy as it gets, this side of Mossy Kingdom gets a lot of moisture. The primary holds are cleaned from time to time but expect it to be overgrown if no one has climbed it recently. Stand start on the right side of the boulder and work your way up. This climb is pretty straightforward.
content.location: Easy to find once you are at the base of the largest cliff face. Look for "Simba" as it's the easiest boulder to identify in the area. This boulder is a stone-throw away from "Simba". It's located on a slight slope surrounded partially by mountain laurel.

content.description: A relatively straightforward route from the lower left side to the middle of the boulder and up to the highest point.
content.location: It's a pretty easy spot to find if you start from "Warm Up Boulder" or "Simba" and walk to the right till you find a wall half covered in moss. The landing is on a slight slope.

content.description: A group of small boulders at the base of the cliff. The boulder "Mossy Kingdom 2" is usually a bit damp but the other three are generally dry.
